dialogue: First on the agenda, we're standardizing all screen savers to be our company logo.
Second, our CEO is having a contest to see who can suggest the most useless corporate rule to eliminate.
I nominate the new screen-saver rule.
You can't nominate that one. It's too new.
Why does that matter? Isn't it better to kill it before it gets implemented?
It's too soon! It's just too soon!
I nominate whatever is next on the agenda.
